title: Understanding direction and strenght
text: Negative correlations mean that as one variable increases, the other decreases.The closer the number is to $$-1$$, the stronger the negative relationship.

title: Identify the changing variable
text: What happens to exam grades when absences increase?

title: Determine the direction
text: Do the two variables move together or in opposite directions?

title: Assess the strength
text: Is this relationship likely strong or weak?

hintAnswer: Strong and in the oppositve direction (one increase, the other decrease)
title: Combine the findings
text: How would you summarize the link between absences and grades?
choices: Strong and in the oppositve direction (one increase, the other decrease)
Stong and in the same direction (increase or decrease together)
Weak and in the same direction
Weak and in the opposite direction
